page.title: 05The Market in Honiton
page.content: The market has been held in Honiton for many centuries and until recent years it was held in the High Street. Now the cattle market is held every Tuesday on a permanent site by the Community College. Cows, sheep, poultry and pigs are bought and sold by farmers from Devon and Somerset. Husseys the auctioneers are a local firm. The street market is still held along the High Street on Tuesdays and Saturdays selling meat, fish, vegetables, flowers, antiques and fabrics. This year a new covered market was opened alongside the New Dolphin Hotel. Fish, meat, fruit, vegetables, antiques and tablelinen are sold daily. There is also a small cafe.
